BR_text.BRsummary: Type check for value of max_iterations
BR_text.BRdescription:
In Style Transfer, the model create() method accepts strings as a valid input for max_iterations
 <denchmark-code>In [40]: model = tc.style_transfer.create(styles, content, max_iterations='dummy_string')
 Using 'image' in style_dataset as feature column and using 'image' in content_dataset as feature column
 Using CPU to create model
 Analyzing visual features of the style images
 +--------------+--------------+--------------+
 | Iteration    | Loss         | Elapsed Time |
 +--------------+--------------+--------------+
 | 1            | 10.074       | 30.2         |
 | 2            | 12.195       | 51.9         |
 | 3            | 20.362       | 73.7         |
 | 4            | 27.661       | 95.8         |
 | 5            | 47.275       | 117.6        |
 | 6            | 43.512       | 139.5        |
 | 7            | 48.951       | 161.2        |
 | 8            | 47.235       | 183.0        |
 | 9            | 61.822       | 204.7        |
 | 10           | 65.091       | 226.7        |
 | 11           | 67.914       | 249.0        |
 </denchmark-code>

comments_0.comment_text: We probably also shouldn't allow int values below 1.

comments_1.comment_text:
The <denchmark-link:https://apple.github.io/turicreate/docs/api/generated/turicreate.object_detector.create.html#turicreate.object_detector.create>Object Detector's create method</denchmark-link>
  allows you to pass 0, then it will automatically determine the batch size based on resource availability. That might be something we want to standardize on.
